kszucs commented on pull request #6894: ARROW-8388: [C++][CI] Ensure Arrow compiles with GCC 4.8
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6894#discussion_r406832222
 
 

 ##########
 File path: .github/workflows/python.yml
 ##########
 @@ -203,3 +203,36 @@ jobs:
       - name: Test
         shell: bash
         run: ci/scripts/python_test.sh $(pwd) $(pwd)/build
+
+  manlinux1:
+    name: manlinux1 Python 2.4
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    if: ${{ !contains(github.event.pull_request.title, 'WIP') }}
+    env:
+      ARROW_BUILD_SHARED: ON
+      ARROW_BUILD_STATIC: OFF
+      ARROW_BUILD_TYPE: debug
+      ARROW_BUILD_TESTS: OFF
+      ARROW_DATASET: ON
+      ARROW_FLIGHT: ON
+      ARROW_PARQUET: ON
+      ARROW_PYTHON: ON
+      ARROW_GANDIVA: ON
+      ARROW_FILESYSTEM: ON
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout Arrow
+        uses: actions/checkout@v2
+        with:
+          fetch-depth: 0
+      - name: Fetch Submodules and Tags
+        shell: bash
+        run: ci/scripts/util_checkout.sh
+      - name: Docker Pull
+        shell: bash
+        run: docker-compose pull centos-python-manylinux1
+      - name: Docker Run
+        shell: bash
+        run: |
+          sudo sysctl -w kernel.core_pattern="core.%e.%p"
+          ulimit -c unlimited
+          docker-compose run centos-python-manylinux1 bash /io/build_arrow.sh
 
 Review comment:
   ```suggestion
             docker-compose run centos-python-manylinux1
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
See https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6883#issuecomment-611661733

This is a recurring problem which usually shows up as a broken nightly (the gandiva nightly jobs, specifically) along with similar issues due to gcc 4.8's incomplete handling of c++11. As long as someone depends on these we should probably have an every-commit CI job which checks we haven't introduced such a breakage
fields.summary: [C++] GCC 4.8 fails to move on return
